title: (x) SendOutCards logo - Nueva Condensed {Tiff, Mike F}
content:
Snappy company name. Any philes know this font?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011013219im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/SOClogo_6454.jpg)

 [‹ (x) "The Kingdom of Love" (1914) Art Nouveau sheet music cover - hand lettered {Andrew Chipman}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011013219/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44084 "Go to previous forum topic") [Tuscan-style "Patriots" logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011013219/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44102 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jrgott

comments.content: [Nueva Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011013219/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/nueva_std_condensed_ot/) or it could be the regular weight just squooshed a bit.

Sharp. She’s so sharp. I’m curious, is that actually all filed in your brain Miss T? Most impressive, whatever your resources.

Also is squooshed the technical term?

-JR

“actively engaged in making myself into what I ought not be”

Perfect. Hopefully I can use it with permission if I credit the trademarker in question...

Edit: FYI it is Nueva Condensed...squooshed. (tm)
Squooshed isn’t a technical term, just the term that illicits the pain these poor letters must feel. ;^)
Tiff hasn’t got anything to do with the credit. ;^)
Hehe. Yeah, Yves does the crediting round these here parts. And yeah, I meant elicits. How embarrassing.
